feed.title: TXHASH + CHECKSIGFROMSTACKVERIFY in lieu of CTV and ANYPREVOUT

entry.title: TXHASH + CHECKSIGFROMSTACKVERIFY in lieu of CTV and ANYPREVOUT
entry.summary: In an email thread discussing the limitations of using TXHASH for transaction introspection and the usefulness of Discreet Log Contracts (DLCs) as oracles, Anthony Towns mentioned that the latter already provides all the interesting oracle behavior one can get without transaction introspection and decent math opcodes. However, someone pointed out that Towns left out the ability of CSFSV to do pubkey delegation. The context suggests a technical discussion among individuals knowledgeable about blockchain technology and its various components.
